task.title: How to practice your information modeling

step.cmd: Gather existing contents from user and start your analysis.
step.info: The contents may be unstructured or unsorted. But do not be disappointed. It is usual status in reality.

step.cmd: Divide them into small peaces of topic.
step.info: You should select appropriate topic size, not too small and not too big.

ul.li: Topic type will become task, reference, concept, glossary or troubleshooting.
You can create your own topic types if necessary.

step.cmd: Make templates for authoring based on information type.
step.info: Current authoring tool supports making your own templates for inexperienced users.

step.cmd: Submit your decisions to information architecture team.
step.info: It is important to explain how DITA and DITA-OT architecture differs from legacy publishing one.
There may be heated discussions because users does not practice DITA architecture at this moment.

ul.li: It is important to collaborate with authors to understand the information model and apply it properly.
Also it is important to publish the new contents with stylesheet work to show the results to the manager.

step.cmd: Evaluate the modeling work and go ahead if it is succeeded.
